\vspace{2cm}
{\bf Abstract}
\vspace{1cm}

\parbox{12.5cm}{
We analyse the effect of general brane kinetic terms for bulk scalars,
fermions and gauge bosons in theories with extra dimensions, with and
without supersymmetry. We find in particular a singular behaviour when
these terms contain derivatives orthogonal to the 
brane. This is brought about by $\delta(0)$ divergences arising at
second and higher order in perturbation theory. We argue that
this behaviour can be smoothed down by classical renormalization.
}
